intro: Aspidogyne harlingii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its pinnate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, round, orange-red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its roots and stems contain various alkaloids, which have been studied for potential pharmacological properties. Aspidogyne harlingii is often found in moist, shaded habitats in forest understories.
